attributes.action: Make the placing and/or using of all snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The frantic struggles of the trapped animal cause the snare wire to knot so that it tightens and the animal dies of strangulation. This barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too.
attributes.additional_details:
Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. A (legal) free-running snare is supposed to slacken when the animal stops struggling, however a rusted, kinked or knotted snare effectively becomes self-locking.

If any snares remain legal, then it is harder to enforce the law against illegal snares or against illegal use of legal snares.

attributes.action: Abolish vat and council tax
attributes.background: Vat and council got introduced after we joined the European Union. No we are leaving it should be removed from citizens in the uk.

attributes.action: Introduce more tax for Buy To Let Landlords and Foreign Property Investors
attributes.background:
Homes are for living in, they are not pension pots. Prices are now ridiculous, driven up by greedy investors. Politicians fear losing elections if house prices fall, yet high prices do not even benefit them either.
Bring down house prices now!
attributes.additional_details:
Wages not in line with rising house prices. Drastic change is needed.
The entire economy should not be functioning on house prices.

attributes.action: Allow enlisted men to bear arms around the clock for personal protection in UK
attributes.background:
Our serving military should be allowed to carry sidearms at all times for self defense and for national security so they may act without hesitation to any terrorist threat to themselves or our nation
Our military are trained and are under oath to serve and protect our nation!
Please sign and share
attributes.additional_details:
No more attacks on our protectors like the horrific killing of Fusilier Lee Rigby RIP
Stop the attempted abductions of our serving men and women.
Give our heros the chance to protect themselves along with protecting our nation.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Make sex work a protected characteristic under the Equality Act
attributes.background: The 2010 Equality Act does not include sex workers e.g. escorts, strippers, and porn actors, as a protected characteristic. Former sex workers can be discriminated against at work e.g. teachers may be fired if their past is exposed, despite it not impacting their ability to do their job.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of sex workers are also women, LGBT+ (particularly transgender), disabled or belong to an ethnic minority. While these characteristics are protected, the fact that a disproportionate amount of sex workers belong to vulnerable groups means that they are still indirectly disadvantaged in the workplace.

For more info on sex work in the UK: http://prostitutescollective.net/

The Equality Act and discrimination:
https://www.gov.uk/discrimination-your-rights/types-of-discrimination

attributes.action: Ask the Government to set out clear proposals for leaving the EU
attributes.background:
We have voted to leave the EU,
BUT we have been given no clear idea of the Government's plans for
1. Our future trading relationships with the rest of the world;
2. Meeting the wishes of dissident parts of the UK.
These plans should be submitted for ratification by the public or Parliament.

attributes.action: Establish Fibromyalgia clinics  to improve services for chronic pain in the Uk.
attributes.background: Fibromylgia is a chronic. syndrome affecting 1 in 20 of the population. Although it can be diagnosed easily by Rheumotologists,  GP's in local surgeries are often unable to make a diagnosis, or provide the level of medical care and support which is necessary .
attributes.additional_details:
Fibromyalgia is identified by pain in all 4 quadrants of the body, chronic fatigue and sleeping disorders. It is a complex condition involving many other symptoms from Irritable Bowel Syndrome, cognitive impairment, poor and poor co ordination to severe headaches ,Temporal Mandible Joint pain , and many others.
Providing clinics which run in a similar manner to diabetic clinics, would provide a higher standard of support for Fibromyalgia patients.These clinics are being trialled in some parts of the UK reducing trips to A and E departments,  clinic waiting times and the number of visits to a variety of other clinics.

attributes.action: Fund adrenaline auto-injectors and training for life-threatening asthma attacks
attributes.background: Out of hospital asthma attacks kill 800 per year. News reports attest to the helplessness of parents and bystanders. At autopsy lungs are blocked with mucus plugs. Intramuscular adrenaline opens airways, reduces mucus, allows cough, and on arrival paramedics give it as part of severe asthma guidance
attributes.additional_details: President Obama's 2013 bill allowed adrenaline auto-injector use and training in schools for acute asthma and anaphylaxis with a Good Samaritan proviso. National Review of Asthma Deaths NRAD 2014 said "consider auto injectors if a patient had a previous life-threat attack or near fatal episode", which is no help in first time attacks. EpiPen, Jext, and Emerade needles pass through clothing injecting drug into thigh muscle; 2 or 3 injections may be needed. Ref. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207207

attributes.action: Call for a UK referendum on the abolition of the "unelected" UK monarchy.
attributes.background: We have elected to leave the EU. One of the many arguments for the case of the UK leaving was to disconnect ourselves from the influence of unelected officials making choices on our behalf. So why stop with the EU? Let us now have a referendum on the relevance of the monarchy in our new modern UK.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election by May 2017 to ensure UK not governed by unelected PM
attributes.background: During the referendum the Leave campaign continually stressed that a key issue was not wanting to be governed by unelected representatives (even though EU has elected MEPs). Therefore, now there is such key work to be done, we must have a nationally elected Prime Minister, not a nominated one.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament needs to act to call a General Election before May 2017 to ensure that key decisions are taken with a true mandate. As part of this, no action should be taken by any interim prime minister to activate Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

attributes.action: Review the lack of increases in Carers Allowance for full time carers.
attributes.background:
According to a recent survey, carried out by the Carers Trust, caring for sick and/or disabled family members is taking its toll on the health of the nations unpaid carers.

This is going to lead to a care crisis in this country as well as be a massive drain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
A carer needs to look after someone for a minimum 35 hours a week, in order, to receive Carers Allowance of £62.10, that`s just £1.78 an hour or less which is far below the National Living Wage and has not been increased the way pensions have.

With the effect of Austerity policies meaning that financial support for carers in the form of Council Tax and Housing benefit having been slashed we are now struggling to survive and we're forced back into part-time work to survive.

We need action now.

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption, without crime!
attributes.background: I was abused as a child and domestically, as a result I have PTSD. Although I left my partner, moved far away from my family, made great improvements with my ptsd, and had support, my newborn was taken at birth, and has been placed for adoption without my consent, based on a risk of emotional harm
attributes.additional_details:
This dismisses the law, and rights to a private and family life. And it dismisses the rights of my son, who has the right to be within his birth family.
I have committed no crime to anyone, adult or child. I have no addictions.
The law should be changed , so that no child can be taken without parental consent, if no crime has been committed and if there are no addictions. Instead family's should be worked with and supported to be a family by child services before any further action is considered

attributes.action: Pressurise Russia to stop targeting civilians in Syria.
attributes.background: We demand the UK Government use its international powers and standing in order to pressurise Russia so as to end the deliberate targeting of civilians and civilian infrastructure in Syria, as well as to negotiate access routes with Turkey, for medics and medical supplies to Syria.
attributes.additional_details:
-1557 civilian victims in July 2016 alone
- Over 1,000 deaths at the hands of the Regime and Russian forces.
- 25 medics and civil defense personnel dead in July 2016, alone
- Russia has killed more civilians than ISIS or Assad

"despicable pattern of unlawful attacks deliberately targeting medical facilities (Amnesty International, 2016)."

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/07/syria-fatal-airstrike-on-maternity-hospital-a-potential-war-crime/

http://sn4hr.org/blog/2016/08/06/25347/

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/syria-war-aleppo-news-latest-air-strikes-children-civilians-killed-bombing-hospital-market-russia-a7187356.html

https://www.facebook.com/liveupdatesfromsyria/?fref=nf

http://www.iamsyria.org/death-tolls-july-2016.html

attributes.action: Change the motorway speed limit to 85 MPH.
attributes.background: The problem with motorways in UK that I find is that we have roads of good enough standard and management that could take up faster traffic.  I Really find a problem where it is allowed to go up to 60 MPH on a narrow road with sharp bends but only 70 MPH on wide and safe motorway.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries in europe have much higher motorway speed limit  road conditions: Belgium (74MPH), France, Austria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland (80 MPH), Germany (NONE - unless stated otherwise)
In some of those countries where the speed limit of 80 MPH applies the motorway road conditions are far much worse than in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Introduce a "Trading Standards" body for politicians
attributes.background: Politicians supporting the "Leave" and "Remain" EU campaigns are now backing down from their campaign claims and promises, with no punishment. A member of the public providing misleading sales information would be subjected to fines/imprisonment. We want politicians to be subject to the same rules.
attributes.additional_details: We want an independent body to hold politicians to account.  This body should have the power to impose personal sanctions for misleading statements. These sanctions should be unlimited fines and imprisonment as can currently be imposed by Trading Standards on members of the public.  The punishment should reflect the scale and impact of the misleading statement.

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.
attributes.background: All over the UK fairgrounds and similar events are still giving away goldfish as prizes, this is an outdated practice that needs to be banned as these fish are kept in poor condition and it goes against all the work that goes into educating the public on how to properly look after their fish.
attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cars to pass horses at no more than 15mph
attributes.background: There is an increase in the number of tragic accidents caused by vehicles passing horses far too quickly and not allowing sufficient room to pass.   This can be reduced by making it a legal requirement for vehicles to pass slow and wide.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Make St George's day a public holiday.
attributes.background: Theresa May's first act as Prime Minister should be to make St George's day a public holiday thereby uniting all of England through patriotism as well as helping to boost the British Economy.

attributes.action: We the British public want our govt to offer the hand of friendship to Russia
attributes.background: With Donald J Trump as the new elect president of the United States of America and has recently offered the hand of friendship to Russia and Putin, we the British public do not see this as a threat and we want our government to offer the hand of friendship to Russia also.
attributes.additional_details:
In regards to the Independent newspaper publishing on 13/11/2016 Trump-Putin alliance sparks diplomatic crisis http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/trump-putin-alliance-sparks-diplomatic-crisis/ar-AAke2CD?ocid=spartanntp
We the British public want our government to offer a hand of friendship to Russia to work towards peace.
We the British public want our government to become allies with Russia.
We the British public do not want our government to plan on removing Assad from power in the east.

attributes.action: Make parking on pavement illegal so we wheelchair and pramchairs get through
attributes.background: When people have parked on pavement. We,  disabled with all sorts of wheelchair  can't get through to the narrow gap between the pavement and wall on the narrow street. That's including all sorts of pushchairs and pramchairs. So make it illegal by parking their cars on pavement anywhere in the UK

attributes.action: Make smear tests accessible at the age of consent, as opposed to at aged 25.
attributes.background: The legal national age for consent is 16. Smear tests aren't available until the age of 25. Meaning that any given woman could go for up to 9 years, without being screened for abnormal and dangerous cells.
attributes.additional_details: HPV, for example is contracted through sexual activity and is a leading cause for cervical cancer. Regardless of age, anyone can contract HPV and although it is now immunised for in most teenage girls, many women have no idea of the damage it causes before it's too late. A cervical screen test / smear test - is a method of detecting abnormal cells on the cervix. The cervix is the entrance to the womb from the vagina. Detecting and removing abnormal cervical cells can prevent cervical cancer.

attributes.action: Sanctions on the Palestinian Authority affecting all funds going from the UK
attributes.background: In response to the non uk broadcast death of a 13 year old girl in her bedroom in Israel, her throat being slit whilst she slept, by a Palestinian terrorist. This is not the first time and sadly it certainly will not be the last.
attributes.additional_details:
See Israeli news and foreign media reports. Speak to the conservative and labour friends of Israel groups.
In response to the non uk broadcast death of a 13 year old girl in her bedroom in Israel, her throat being slit whilst she slept, by a Palestinian terrorist, sanctions to be placed against the Palestinian authority affecting all funds going from the UK to them, as well as to Hamas, until they put an end to calls for citizens to use knives in attacks on Israeli men, women and children.

attributes.action: Scrap IR35 legislation reform proposals for public sector off-payroll workers.
attributes.background:
The proposal is to make ‘engagers’ deduct PAYE tax & NIC at source for self-employed people operating via a Limited Company if the end client is in the public sector.
This will severely reduce the income of such individuals but confer none of the rights & benefits of a staff employee.
attributes.additional_details:
Further information at the following sites:

http://www.f9consulting.co.uk/crisis-for-public-sector-contractors/

http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/smallbusiness/article-3761454/Tax-ruling-contractors-leave-public-sector-work.html

https://www.cchdaily.co.uk/planned-public-sector-ir35-reforms-could-see-ps115m-tax-loss

https://www.ipse.co.uk/news/ir35-proposal-how-will-you-get-paid-april-2017

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy

attributes.action: Stop the total smoking ban in psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Legislation comes into force in NHS psychiatric hospitals on 1st October 2016.  Smoking is already limited to certain areas and at certain times so those who do not smoke are not adversely affected.  The last thing distressed people need is to have their de-stressing mechanism denied them.
attributes.additional_details: I have a relative who is on her 3rd "episode", hence another lengthy stay on a mental health ward.  New arrivals to a ward are already under stress.  I am not a smoker myself but I see many patients desperate for the next smoking break to help them relax.  Who will have to deal with this extra agitation?  Staff who are already under pressure.  The legislation may be well intentioned but I think it is totally wrong to impose a smoking ban on patients who are locked up and whose "home" is the ward

attributes.action: Mandatory for every borough to provide a park for children with Special needs
attributes.background: Disabled children deserve to be treated equally in societie. It is taken for granted to go to a park as a child swing on a swing so why are children with additional needs not being provided with the basic childhood memories. We need every town to have a park for disabled children not isolate them.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this campaign for change equality for our children. Give Special needs children a childhood. A right to play!

attributes.action: UK Government to stop using the term 'Islamic State' & refer to them as 'Daesh'.
attributes.background: In the wake of many terrorist attacks around the world, the British Government must not associate the religious beliefs of 3 million UK Muslims with that of a terrorist organisation. Doing so aids hate crimes and the social campaigns of the terrorists. The name "Daesh" should be used in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: I am a Muslim living in the UK. When I hear the term "Islamic State", "ISIL" or "so-called Islamic State", I wonder why we are assisting the terrorists in their hate campaigns. I find it an insult to hear the term used, as would the 400,000 Muslims that served this land in World War 1 or currently serving in the army. These terrorists are referred to as "Daesh" in predominantly Muslim countries. The term "Islamic State" is a perversion of a religion, consisting of 23% of the global population.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be allowed with a specific liecence per event
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause injury to bystanders.  
Fireworks cause distress people's pets. 
Fireworks should only be ignited by a pyrotechnics person.
Fireworks should not be allowed on private property they should only be allowed in a designated public area with a specific license per event.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the risks fireworks bring it is requested that they are only ignited by a professional pyrotechnics person.  They should only be allowed in designated public places. They should require a licence from the local council. This will safe guard children and animals and ensure this safety risk and noise pollution is managed in a fair socially considered manner

attributes.action: Reduce Overseas Aid from 0.7% GDP to 0.35% to fund Social Care in the UK
attributes.background: Social Care in the UK is hugely underfunded. Meanwhile our Overseas Aid budget of 0.7% of GDP (@£12bn) is among the most generous in the world. Reduce the target to 0.35%, which is more in line with Germany 0.4%, Canada 0.3% and USA 0.2%, and release the estimated £6bn to fund Social Care in the UK.

attributes.action: I propose a referendum to Ban the Burqa in public to be set into UK law
attributes.background: Due to governments once again not listening to the people who elect them I propose you hold a referendum to ban the burqa in all public spaces.  Let the people decide the fate / destiny of our country rather than politically correct politicians worried about being re-elected.
attributes.additional_details: https://yougov.co.uk/news/2016/08/31/majority-public-backs-burka-ban/

attributes.action: Stop plans to pay for the restoration of properties belonging to the super rich.
attributes.background: In the current economic climate, it is morally wrong to use public funds to pay for the restoration of such buildings as Wentworth Woodhouse and Buckingham Palace. The owners of said properties should be the ones to pay and the money earmarked for this should be passed on to the NHS immediately.

attributes.action: Scrap the idea to hand over maintenance responsibility from Network Rail to TOCs
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government announced[1] a decision to instead of having a state run company maintaining Britain's rail network to instead hand over the responsibility to private TOC's. Her Majesty's Government has previously privatized the maintenance with disastrous results[2][3][4]
attributes.additional_details:
[1] http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/02/exclusive-network-rail-stripped-control-britains-train-tracks/

[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bexley_railway_station#History

[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatfield_rail_crash#Cause

[4]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potters_Bar_rail_accidents#2002

attributes.action: To give assistant/therapy dogs the same recognition as Guide and Hearing dogs.
attributes.background: Guide/Hearing Dogs are recognised by shops to give them admission. However, therapy and assistance don't have the rights to enter establishments with those they support, this disadvantages the person the dog is with. I am looking to give these useful dogs the same recognition in law.

attributes.action: Make menstrual cups available on the NHS
attributes.background: According to a Huffington Post article women spend £6000 on sanitary products in a lifetime.Providing menstrual cups on the NHS would save women thousands. As they are reuseable it not only provides a good solution for the costly issues but also the environmental issues that sanitary products create
attributes.additional_details: Women on average use around 11,000 disposable sanitary products in a lifetime, which end up in a landfill or the sea. The time it takes for a tampon or pad to degrade in landfills is centuries, particularly when wrapped in a plastic bag. Ocean Conservancy volunteers collected 27,938 used tampons and applicators on our world’s beaches on a single day (International Coastal Cleanup, 2013). Since a menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years, using one would prevent a decade's worth of waste.

attributes.action: Ensure  the UK can trade tariff free in the EU single market after Brexit
attributes.background: It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

attributes.action: Abolish the pay to stay proposals in the current housing bill.
attributes.background: The pay to stay policy is part of the current Housing Bill that is going through parliament. This policy will mean social housing tenants who's household income exceeds £30,000 (£40,000 in London) will be required to pay market rents for their home. This will have a devastating affect on families.
attributes.additional_details: There are several articles circulating with people's stories and how it will affect them. I believe the threshold is far too low, as a family earning £3/40,000 a year would not be able to buy a home on this income. Moreover, there are no controls on the current market so prices are ridiculously high. Families will split to avoid exceeding the threshold or the stress/strain of paying 150% more in rent. This policy will make people homeless or push 1000s into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Use funding used for TV's in prison cells for TV's for the elderly in hospital
attributes.background: Many elderly people who have fallen or become unwell, have no relations, comfort or entertainment in hospital, yet prisons continue to have TVs for prisoners, who have other entertainment, and social lives, this funding should be prioritised to help older or vulnerable people, with nothing else.
attributes.additional_details: After having worked for many years in the health care sector, I have seen many vulnerable adults with no family network endure a time in hospital with no comforts, family or friends, for someone elderly or with dementia this can be unfamiliar and scary, due to funding, TVs cannot be provided for beds in many hospitals around the UK, yet many prison cells have TVs, on top of a social life, a small allowance and more. These TV's could be used to make the day brighter for those with nothing else.

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: Provide food, shelter, rehabilitation and caring for every homeless person
attributes.background:
The homeless situation in Britain is a terrible stain on our home nations.  Having anybody living on the streets in such a developed society is deplorable.

To let it happen because it is felt that people have fell through the cracks, don't try or have chosen their misfortune is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that as much as 25% of homeless people are ex service personal.

People in derived areas are doubly jeopardised by not having life chances of an affluent, structured, stable upbringing and are more susceptible to finding themselves on the fringes of society.

This is the age of one nation Britain and we need to care and nurture all.

We would like to see Parliament open up homeless rehabilitation centres to be able to accommodate everybody on the streets, to get their life back

attributes.action: Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU; keeping UK in EU.
attributes.background:
Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU so Leavers can Leave EU. Keep post-Partition UK a full EU member state (do not activate Art.50) so Remainers can Remain in EU.
Precedents: Isle of Man, Jersey & Guernsey are BCDs outside EU.
When Greenland left Denmark, Denmark stayed EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full Petition Text & Detailed List of the 7 new BCDs' areas (with % Leave vote figures): http://tinyurl.com/ntg88ta
Maps of 7 BCDs: 
http://tinyurl.com/orygvny 
http://tinyurl.com/ogb3qnk
Further:
UK Govt to assign finance & civil servants to help each of new BCDs get its Govt / Parliament set up.
Defence still by UK; major roads, rail, power grids & nuclear reactors stay UK territory; later on BCDs contribute finances. 
Reciprocal NHS Arrangement between BCDs & UK (like Isle of Man & UK now).

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: Fund the NHS more money so that ambulance response times improve
attributes.background: Ambulances take a long time to get to people. My Grandfather broke his leg and the ambulance didn't get to him till an hour after being called. If the ambulance had responded sooner then his pain would've been relieved quicker. Give more money to the NHS and stuff like this would be prevented

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA).
attributes.background: The UK referendum rejected membership of the EU but voters were unable to express a preference for remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA - the Single Market). The most logical and democratic way to resolve this question is to have a new referendum with a new question.
attributes.additional_details: The EEA is the single market - it is Europe without Federalist aspirations. It allows the UK to trade freely with the EU. The UK is a signatory of this agreement and the "presumption of continuity" allows the UK to remain within the EEA if we so choose; there is no mechanism to eject us. The result of the EU referendum has been distorted and misinterpreted. The only thing we can conclude is that voters did not want to be part of the EU; EEA membership was not voted on.

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Change the law to require all bus companies to offer free travel for children
attributes.background: In London 11 to 15 year olds currently get free travel. This should be available to all children nationally and the law should be changed to require bus companies to offer free travel to children nationally. This would reduce congestion & pollution as parents would encourage children to use buses.

attributes.action: Make all foreign vehicles entering the UK pay a road tax.
attributes.background: When we drive across the channel we are expected to pay road tax in many European countries, either by way of motorway tolls, or by purchasing a vignette.  However, any vehicle can enter the UK from Europe and are able to travel free of road tax.  Why is this allowed to carry on?
attributes.additional_details: Vignettes could be purchased at the port of entry, or on line, in much the same way as the purchase system on the borders of Switzerland and Austria.  In Switzerland we have to purchase an annual vignette, and in Austria we are able to purchase a three month vignette.  Our roads are crammed with foreign trucks, and I strongly believe that some form of British road tax should be levied to ease the burden of the high road repair costs.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to discrimination against families when renting property.
attributes.background: Tennants with children are finding it increasingly difficult to rent a suitable, 2 bedroom property. Landlords and agents are using the unfair excuse that children cause extra wear on the property, yet a deposit is still taken to cover damages. It is leaving young families in difficult situations
attributes.additional_details:
My partner and I are currently facing homelessness after being served a section 21 on our flat. The landlord has decided to renovate the property, but will not allow children in it once it is finished. 
While searching for a new place for us to live, we are consistently met with the "No pets, No Children" statement.Like our daughter is as low as a dog! We live in an expensive area and are struggling to find suitable properties that allow children.

attributes.action: We do not want a Norwegian EEC paid membership trade deal, or a Swiss deal.
attributes.background:
In the recent EU in/out referendum, the majority of the UK voted to leave the european union and we do not want a Norwegian or Swiss deal which would defeat the leave vote and why we voted leave.
We do not want to be a paid member of the EEC single market trading zone.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Conservative ministers have been reported by the BBC, Boris Johnson in particular of desiring a Norwegian trade zone membership deal against the interests of Britain and the majority of British voters who voted to leave europe and the single market.

Staying in the single market will do the economic damage David Cameron was talking about, and it will prevent us taking back control of our borders, immigration, fishing limits and full law making powers therefore it is against public interest.
